column4: There is a command line alternative to cdrecord?  cdrecord isn't inter-operating with cron so good.
Do mpg files have some kind of ID3 tag in them?
what about a UNIX utility I can use to read the id3 tag?
id3tools
'apt-cache search id3tools' says there's no package named that in the ubuntu repositories.  There's another name for this package?
my bad, it's called id3tool
minus the "s" :)
mpgtx - Toolbox to manipulate MPEG files (video, system, and audio)

i just looked at mpgtx quickly.  You know that mpgtx will tell me the number of seconds, or you were suggesting to look into that?  Cause, looking quickly, I don't see where mpgtx tells the number of seconds.
Sorry I dont know it, just found it when searching for id3tools
loosers with lots of time to waste :)
apparently, i can't imagine why that's fun just to send a lot of random characters into a channel
mplayer is the only one usable on cheezy hardware...
it works fine
email to root will be sent to you admin user.
check out /etc/aliases
actually, /etc/aliases has root aliased to my local user name
wasn't that what you wanted?
i was saying it works for my regular user, but not for the root user
any reason you want to send mail as root?

I don't want to send mail as root.  I want to send mail to root.  I've got a cron job set up to backup my system. This script has to be run as root.  I don't want the email going to the root user, I never check that email.  And, I certainly don't want that email going to my ISP, as root's email is now.
But, apparently, mailing to 'root@localhost' works fine, it's just mailing to 'root' that's not working.
